triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper employs adaptive control techniques for compensating actuator faults through real-time parameter adjustment.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multi-agent systems which require specialized nonlinear control techniques.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a neural observer based on state observer theory to estimate unmeasured system states.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the formation control problem for nonlinear multi-agent systems with communication and fault constraints.

triples.name: Fault tolerance
triples.relevance: The paper designs fault-tolerant control mechanisms to compensate for actuator faults and maintain system safety.

triples.name: Feedback linearization
triples.relevance: The paper uses control design techniques related to nonlinear feedback for handling nonlinear multi-agent system dynamics.

triples.name: Universal approximation theorem
triples.relevance: The paper relies on neural network approximation theory to construct neural observers for nonlinear system state estimation.

triples.name: Closed-loop controller
triples.relevance: The paper designs distributed closed-loop control schemes that use feedback from agent states and neighbors to achieve formation control.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies fundamental control theory principles for designing event-triggered formation control systems.
